reviewText: I have to say I was very disappointed. I don't know if the issue is the recording or the streaming, but I had no sound. I tried changing the volume on the TV, checking the settings, switching to the sound bar, changing televisions, no matter what I did-no sound. Oh well, on to other videos...
summary: Streaming Katrina Fitness Ease Into Pilates
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've only done the first segment on this video, but I really enjoyed it and I felt it the next day.  If you grew up in the aerobics era Pilates will feel strange to you at first because there is no bouncing, no gasping for breath, no trying-not-to-die during the routine.  If you enjoy that intense stuff, that's fine, but exercising like that doesn't work for everyone.  Pilates is an excellent choice for those of us who desire a low-impact workout.  You will feel it the next day if you challenge yourself.  Katrina's workout is pleasant and hits all the major areas.  I'll continue to do this.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Some people may be turned off to find that is as much about yoga as Pilates, but that made it appealing to me.  The one negative is that beginners will usually not be able to keep up with Katrina.  One of her sidekicks does modified poses, but they are usually without verbal instruction and sometimes hard to see due to the camera angle or the fact that the camera is focused on someone else.  On the whole, though, definitely worth trying.
summary: Really a blend of yoga and Pilates
Title: N/A

reviewText: Easy to follow for a beginner, good pace. Explanations are concise and good to be able to do in a modified manner, if needed.
summary: Yoga for Newbies and Fraddie Cats
Title: N/A

reviewText: Ease Into Pilates is a step-by-step, 34-minute, full color, DVD introduction to a physical fitness program that emphasizes using multiple muscles simultaneously, and which was first introduced in the early 1900s by Joseph H. Pilates. Now popular for its health, flexibility, and workout benefits, Pilates is accessible to all ages and fitness levels. Katrina Fitness (aka Katrina Stachowski), AFAA certified fitness instructor of twelve years, takes the viewer on a guided tour through basic Pilates workouts and techniques, including segments devoted to warm-up, strength, abs/back, and relaxation/cool down. Each segment is approximately 10 minutes in length and can be done separately or combined all together to easily accommodate individual needs. Nothing more than a thin Pilates or Yoga mat is needed to take full advantage of Ease Into Pilates.
summary: Nothing more than a thin Pilates or Yoga mat is needed
Title: N/A

reviewText: Sometimes you are just not in the mood for an extremely workout or hard core.  You just want slow and relaxed workout that is good.  This is the workout! Wow!!! I have done many pilates exercise for over 6 years but nothing compares to this one.  I Love it.  It is nice  and targets all your areas.  30 mins does not see like 30 mins. Love it!!!!
